data.text: which the film Casablanca is based, arrived at the story department of Warner Bros. on December 8, 1941, the day after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. This unprovoked action forced America's entry into World War II, which induced Hitler to issue a declaration of war against the United States. America's entry came at a very bleak moment for the Allies. France had fallen in June 1940, large parts of Europe were occupied by German forces, Russia faced possible defeat, and Britain had been subject to aerial bombing of its cities and submarine attacks on its ships. But if the US government and armed forces were now engaged in a war against the Axis powers, it was far from clear that they would enjoy the full and unconditional support of the public. Thus mass persuasion in the form of political propaganda would form a crucial front in the war effort.
